SENT.plain: A retrospective study of 128 feline bone marrow reports identified 13 cases of aplastic anemia
Clinical diagnoses included chronic renal failure (n=5), feline leukemia virus infection (n=2), hyperthyroidism treated with methimazole (n=1) and idiopathic aplastic anemia (n=5)
In some cats, starvation may play a role in the development of marrow aplasia
Some cats with aplastic anemia can have prolonged survival without resolution of the pancytopenia
